properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An area of dense fog is persisting over parts of southern Manitoba tonight. Visibilities are expected to improve throughout the day on Saturday as a drier westerly flow of air develops. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow combined with strong winds will reduce visibilities to near zero over these areas today. Protect yourself from the wind, the cold and disorientation by staying safely inside. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-09T11:59:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T20:26:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3249077146.2021
Area: Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locations: Hopedale and vicinity. Time span: tonight Remarks: Strong northerly winds gusting near 70 km/h will combine with snow to produce very poor visibility in blowing snow. Conditions will improve tonight as the snow begins to taper off and winds begin to diminish. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-09T10:59:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-09T02:29:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2109327097.2021
Area: Hopedale and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Southerly winds are reaching near 100 kilometres per hour today. These high winds will last until early this evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-09T11:59:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T20:26:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1637006418.2021
Area: Salluit

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A strong frontal system will approach the north coast on Saturday. Very strong southeasterly winds of 90 gusting 110 km/h will develop Saturday morning over exposed coastal sections of Haida Gwaii. Winds will ease Saturday evening. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-09T17:06:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-09T01:07:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0999976906.2021
Area: Haida Gwaii
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring over some areas. Large areas of dense fog reducing visibilities on highways are once again forming over much of southeastern Alberta. In addition to the reduced visibility, the fog may create a thin layer of ice on roads making for slippery road conditions. These areas of fog are expected to expand and persist until the late overnight hours and potentially until Saturday morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-09T12:29:32-00:00

properties.Title: Smog Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High concentration of pollutants are expected and will result in poor air quality, especially in urban areas where pollutant emissions are higher. High concentrations of pollutants are expected to continue until late tonight. ### Smog especially affects asthmatic children and people with respiratory ailments or heart disease. It is therefore recommended that these individuals avoid intense physical activity outdoors until the smog warning is lifted. In Quebec, wood heating is the main source of fine particles that contribute to smog during winter. This activity generates the largest number of these particulates, more than industrial activities and transportation. Additional information: To learn more about the Info-Smog program, go to Environment Canada’s website at www.canada.ca/info-smog-program. For air quality indexes in Quebec, visit the website of the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques at www.iqa.environnement.gouv.qc.ca/contenu/index_en.asp. For the air quality index in Montréal, visit the Réseau de surveillance de la qualité de l’air de la Ville de Montréal’s website at www.rsqa.qc.ca (french only). To learn more about the effects of smog on your health in Québec, visit the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux’s website at www.quebec.ca/en/health. You can also visit the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal at www.santemontreal.qc.ca/en/public. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2021-01-09T15:01:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques, the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux, the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal, the City of Montréal, 2021-01-09T03:12:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2049713399.2021
Area: La Sarre area, Amos area, Lebel-sur-Quévillon area, Senneterre area, Rouyn area, Malartic area, Val d'Or - Louvicourt area

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. An area of dense fog is persisting over parts of southern Manitoba tonight. Visibilities are expected to improve throughout the day on Saturday as a drier westerly flow of air develops. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-09T17:06:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-09T01:07:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3987219694.2021
Area: Lake Manitoba
properties.Author: Environment Canada
